thread.title: Let DEMOCRACY speak: Marine Le Pen SLAMS media for censoring French presidential hopefuls
thread.title_full: Let DEMOCRACY speak: Marine Le Pen SLAMS media for censoring French presidential hopefuls

title: Let DEMOCRACY speak: Marine Le Pen SLAMS media for censoring French presidential hopefuls
text:
Le Pen said: “I am pleased that the television stations want to organise debates with the candidates in the presidential election. 
“Finally an opportunity to make competitors who do not want to say anything will have to speak!” 
Despite being geared up to slap down the most popular prospective presidents in the debates, the anti-EU candidate called on the media to allow all voices to be heard. Things you didn't know about Marine Le Pen Mon, February 20, 2017 Marine Le Pen is a French politician who is the president of the National Front, a national-conservative political party in France and one of its main political forces. AFP/Getty Images 1 of 10 Described as more democratic and republican than her nationalist father, she has led a movement of "de-demonization of the Front National" to detoxify it and soften its image GETTY She has slammed national broadcaster TF1, calling them 'outrageous' 
She added: “This decision appears to me arbitrary and totally contrary to the demands of pluralism and democracy. 
“I therefore ask TF1 to reconsider its decision and to allow democracy to express itself in the debate, to be calm and transparent in front of all French people. 
It is not the first time the fiery Frenchwoman has clashed with TF1. GETTY The anti-EU candidate called on the media to allow all voices to be heard GETTY Le Pen's current approval ratings clearly placing her as the frontrunner 
Journalist Paul Larrouturou was allegedly violently thrown out of a press conference after attempting to probe the Front National leader over claims she used EU funds to pay party staff. 
A tense video showed the man as he was pulled away from Ms Le Pen. 
A Front National spokesperson said the party was “in no way responsible” for the hasty eviction and blamed local security staff for manhandling the reporter. Related articles
